subcommands.name: cargo add
subcommands.description: Add dependencies to a Cargo.toml manifest file

options.description: The path base to use when adding from a local crate (unstable).
Git branch to download the crate from

Add as build dependency

Build-dependencies are the only dependencies available for use by build scripts (`build.rs` files).

Add as development dependency

Dev-dependencies are not used when compiling a package for building, but are used for compiling tests, examples, and benchmarks.

These dependencies are not propagated to other packages which depend on this package.
Space or comma separated list of features to activate

Mark the dependency as required

The package will be removed from your features.

Mark the dependency as private (unstable)

While you can use the crate in your implementation, it cannot be referenced in your public API.

Mark the dependency as optional

The package name will be exposed as feature of your crate.
Filesystem path to local crate to add

Mark the dependency as public (unstable)

The dependency can be referenced in your library's public API.
Do not print cargo log messages

Rename the dependency

Example uses:
- Depending on multiple versions of a crate
- Depend on crates with the same name from different registries

Git reference to download the crate from

This is the catch all, handling hashes to named references in remote repositories.
Git tag to download the crate from
Add as dependency to the given target platform
Use verbose output (-vv very verbose/build.rs output)
Unstable (nightly-only) flags to Cargo, see 'cargo -Z help' for details

subcommands.name: cargo bench
subcommands.description: Execute all benchmarks of a local package

options.description: Benchmark only the specified bench target
Benchmark all targets that have `bench = true` set
Number of parallel jobs, defaults to # of CPUs.
Run all benchmarks regardless of failure
Build artifacts with the specified profile
Do not print cargo log messages
Benchmark only the specified test target
Benchmark all targets that have `test = true` set
Timing output formats (unstable) (comma separated): html, json
Use verbose output (-vv very verbose/build.rs output)
Unstable (nightly-only) flags to Cargo, see 'cargo -Z help' for details

Number of parallel jobs, defaults to # of CPUs.
Do not abort the build as soon as there is an error
Build artifacts with the specified profile
Do not print cargo log messages
Build artifacts in release mode, with optimizations
Build only the specified test target
Build all targets that have `test = true` set
Timing output formats (unstable) (comma separated): html, json

Build all packages in the workspace

subcommands.name: cargo init

options.description: Edition to set for the crate generated
Set the resulting package name, defaults to the directory name
Do not print cargo log messages
Initialize a new repository for the given version control system, overriding a global configuration.
tags: possible values: git, hg, pijul, fossil, none

options.description: Use verbose output (-vv very verbose/build.rs output)

Branch to use when installing from git
Build in debug mode (with the 'dev' profile) instead of release mode

Force overwriting existing crates or binaries
Git URL to install the specified crate from
Number of parallel jobs, defaults to # of CPUs.
Do not abort the build as soon as there is an error
List all installed packages and their versions
Filesystem path to local crate to install from
Install artifacts with the specified profile
Do not print cargo log messages
Specific commit to use when installing from git
